extendedInfo.description: 3D Stunt Marbles the most fun and realistic game about stunting your marbles!3D Stunt Marbles uses a cutting edge 3D Physics engine to give you the most realistic experience of your life, demanding skill and concentration to take to negotiate the vast 3D worlds.3D Games offer superior game played to conventional 2D games  like: Angry Birds, Hanging with Friends, Cave Runner, and other popular games."Warning: 3D Stunt Marbles Pro for Android is highly addictive" - TalkAndroid.comGame Features:âEnhanced 3D graphics for high-end devicesâCamera controlsâGraceful usage of your phones accelerometerâNegotiate obstacles including ramps, ledges, tunnels, half-pipes and moreâSuper detailed new graphics engine brings your marble and the game world to lifeâIntuitive tilt control system using the phoneâs accelerometer. Use precision control like never beforeWe appreciate your positive reviews :)keywords: 3D games, 3D marbles, labyrinth, marble madness, 3D cave runner, temple run

reviews.title: Not perfect
reviews.comment: If you really want ugly fonts, follow the example in this game.  Also, what game lets the screen timeout?  On the plus side, I do actually like the labyrinth-type controls.  The ads are quite annoying and obtrusive, though.  I hope more improvements are on the way.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Menus Need Sorting
reviews.comment: Game is great, but the menus and text are all tiny - Asus Infinity TF700T
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Poor!
reviews.comment: Cant even get off the main menu, not showing the full thing or options to start the game on my screen. Let down because it looks good. Sony xperia tipo
reviews.author: Zak Foreman

reviews.title: Dont install
reviews.comment: The game lags, irritating ads, takes too long to restart level, and isnt fun.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Screen timeout? Wtf?
reviews.comment: It is a nice idea and all, but wow, the screen times out at critical moments. Annoying! I mean, sure I can prevent it by just moving the timeout for my screen, but I shouldn\'t have to.
reviews.author: A Google User
